column4: My Ubuntu won't boot all of a sudden and before it gets to login screen, it freezes and now it jumps between tty1 and tty7
X problems
you install nvidia or ati binary drivers?
I just did a shutdown yesterday
it was normal
that doesn't mean much
Is there logs I can see to check wut's wrong?
maybe /var/log/Xorg.0.log
I can access recovery mode... so there's a good sign
I don't see much in the logs
I was wondering if you can help me debug this... I'm totally lost
try stopping X and then try startx
how do I stop X?  it keeps jumping around
try rescue mode and then start xfs, then startx
kk, I'll go try that
ok... how do I start xfs?
/etc/init.d/xfs start  maybe
I can't seem to find xfs... wut is it?
the font server
o, X font server... makes sense
I can't find xfs... hmmmmmmm
